pli-tv-pvr2.9:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr2.9:0.4: The section on where it was laid down
pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.0: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr2.9:1.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of consenting to physical contact was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.1: (5) “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of consenting to physical contact was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.6: The lustful nun Sundarīnandā consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.9: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.13: A rule they do not have in common.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.16: “In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.20: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.22: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.23: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.24: “Through how many of the six kinds of origination of offenses does it originate?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:2.26: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:3.4: these were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.1: These mighty beings of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.2: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path,
pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.3: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law
pli-tv-pvr2.9:5.4: On the island of Sri Lanka.”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.1: (6) “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of concealing offenses—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.6: The nun Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confronting her herself nor telling the community.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:6.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.1: (7) “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of not stopping when pressed up to the third time—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.6: The nun Thullanandā taking sides with the monk Ariṭṭha, formerly a vulture-killer, who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:7.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.1: (8) “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of fulfilling the eight parts—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.4: The nuns from the group of six.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.6: The nuns from the group of six fulfilling the eight parts.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.8: Of the six kinds of origination of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr2.9:8.10: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:9.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension, etc.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:9.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a litigious nun initiating a lawsuit was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.1: (1) “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a litigious nun initiating a lawsuit that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.9: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.13: A rule they do not have in common.
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.16: “In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.27: she originates it by body and by speech and by mind …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:10.28: By whom has it been conveyed?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:13.3: … Vinaya-piṭaka in the Island of Tambapaṇṇi. [1]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of ordaining a woman thief …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:14.10: she originates it … and by mind. [2]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:15.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of going alone among villages … (as) in the first Defeat. [3]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:16.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of restoring a nun suspended by a complete Order, without having obtained permission from the Order which carried out the proceedings in accordance with the rule, with Discipline, with the Teacher’s instruction, not having learnt the group’s desire …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:17.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of a nun who is filled with desire partaking of solid food or soft food that with her own hand she has accepted from the hand of a man who is filled with desire …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of instigating (by) saying, “What can this man, whether he is filled with desire or is not filled with desire, do to you, lady, since you are not filled with desire?
pli-tv-pvr2.9:18.2: Please, lady, eat or partake of the solid food or the soft food that this man is giving to you and that you have accepted with your own hand” …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:19.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of a nun who is angry not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:20.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of a nun, overthrown in some legal question, not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:21.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of nuns who live in company not giving up (their course) though being admonished up to the third time …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:22.1: … requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order because of not giving up (her course) though being admonished up to the third time for one who is instigating saying, “Ladies, live you as though in company, do not you live otherwise” …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.1: … offence to be Confessed because of partaking of curds, having had them asked for …
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.8: she originates it by four origins. [8]
pli-tv-pvr2.9:23.9: Concluded is the First Chapter: on Laying-Down-Where
